Structs

Main.KeyVNA.VNAParameters — Type
VNAParameters

This struct is used to store some important VNA settings and is returned by instrumentSimplifiedSetup.

The fields are:

  • calName::String Calibration label
  • power::Integer Power level
  • center::Float64 Frequency center
  • span::Float64 Frequency span
  • ifbandwidth::Integer IF bandwidth
  • sweepPoints::Integer Sweep points
  • sweepTime::Float64 Sweep time
  • fastSweep::Bool Fast sweep
source

Functions

Main.KeyVNA.connect — Function
connect(host; port=5025)

Establish a TCP connection to the VNA with IP address host. Return a TCPSocket if succesful and nothing if not.

source

[!NOTE] nothing is a return type used in Julia for indicating, that it is intended to return nothing.

send(socket::TCPSocket, msg::String)

Can be used to send any SCPI command directly to the VNA.

Main.KeyVNA.recv — Function
recv(socket::TCPSocket)

Receive and return all buffered bytes from socket. If none are available, wait. Returns a Vector{UInt8}.

source
recv(socket::TCPSocket, nb::Integer)

Receive and return nb number of bytes from socket. Returns a Vector{UInt8}.

source
Main.KeyVNA.instrumentSimplifiedSetup — Function
instrumentSimplifiedSetup(socket::Sockets.TCPSocket; <keyword arguments>)

Change basic settings of the VNA specified by socket. Returns struct VNAParameters.

Keyword Arguments

  • calName::String = cals[:c3GHz]: Name of the calibration to use
  • power::Int = -20: Power level (dBm)
  • center::Float64 = 20.025e9: Center of the frequency band (Hz)
  • span::Float64 = 50e6: Span of the frequency band (Hz)
  • ifbandwidth::Int = Int(5e6): IF Bandwidth (Hz)
  • sweepPoints::Int = 101 Number of sweep points in frequency band
  • fastSweep::Bool = true: Enable Fast Sweep mode
  • measurement::String = "CH1_S11_1": Set which Channel, Parameter and Trace to measure
source
Main.KeyVNA.setPowerLevel — Function
setPowerLevel(socket::TCPSocket, power::Integer)

Set the power level, of the VNA specified by socket, to power dBm.

Main.KeyVNA.setFrequencies — Function
setFrequencies(socket::TCPSocket, center::Float64, span::Float64)

Set frequency band, of the VNA specified by socket. The band is given by the center frequency and the span. The bounds are then given by center ± span/2.

source

source
Main.KeyVNA.setMeasurement — Function
setMeasurement(socket::TCPSocket, name::String)

Set wich measurement, of the VNA specified by socket, to use.

name

The string has to be in a certain format "CH<n>_S<p>_<t>"`, with:

  • n: Channel number
  • p: Scattering parameter
  • t: trace number

For example the String "CH1_S11_1" selects Channel 1, the parameter S11 and the trace 1.

source

Main.KeyVNA.saveS2P — Function
saveS2P(socket::TCPSocket, fileURL::String)

Save the measurement as a S2P file fileUrl onto the VNA internal harddrive.

Note, that the file is not beeing saved on the VNA and not the device, where this function is being called. The file can then be transfered manually.

source
Main.KeyVNA.getFrequencies — Function
getFrequencies(socket::TCPSocket)

Return all the actual sweep points as a Vector{Float64}.

The sweep points are the frequencies at which the scattering parameter is measured during a sweep. They are specified by the number of sweeppoints and the frequency range.

See also setSweepPoints, setFrequencies.

source
Main.KeyVNA.getSweepTime — Function
getSweepTime(socket::TCPSocket)

Returns the time the VNA takes for the sweep.

source
Main.KeyVNA.getTrace — Function
getTrace(socket::TCPSocket)

Performs a sweep and returns a Vector{ComplexF64} of the scattering parameter.

Each element corresponds the the scattering parameter at the frequency given by the element of getFrequencies with the same index.

source
Main.KeyVNA.storeTraceInMemory — Function
storeTraceInMemory(socket::TCPSocket, mnum::Integer)

Perform a sweep and store the trace in the memory of the VNA.

mnum must be a unique integer. It is used to store and identify multiple traces at the same time. If a trace with the same mnum already exists, the VNA will throw an error and the trace is not stored. Existing traces can only be overridden if the it is deleted first. The trace is stored as a measurement called "data_<mnum>" on the VNA. The prefix "data_" is used to distinguish the stored traces from any other created by the VNA itself.

See also deleteTrace, deleteAllTraces and getTraceFromMemory.

source
Main.KeyVNA.getTraceFromMemory — Function
getTraceFromMemory(socket::TCPSocket, mnum::Integer; delete=true)

Returns the trace stored in the memory specified by mnum.

See also getTrace, deleteTrace and deleteAllTraces.

source
Main.KeyVNA.getTraceCatalog — Function
getTraceCatalog(socket::TCPSocket)

Returns a list as a String, with all traces stored in the VNA. Not only those, that are created by storeTraceInMemory.

source
Main.KeyVNA.deleteTrace — Function
deleteTrace(socket::TCPSocket, mnum::Integer)

Delete the trace with the identifier mnum.

source
Main.KeyVNA.deleteAllTraces — Function
deleteAllTraces(socket::TCPSocket)

Delete all traces, which were created by storeTraceInMemory.

source
Main.KeyVNA.complexFromTrace — Function
complexFromTrace(data::Vector{Float64})

Takes the raw datareturned by the VNA and returns aVector{ComplexF64}`.

The VNA returns a Vector{Float64}, where the each complex number is represented by two successive Float64, where the first is the real part and the second the imaginary.

source
